questionListItems.title: Who is eligible for the Caregiver Training Grant (CTG)?

answer.body:
Eligibility Criteria

Caregivers Training Grant (CTG)

Citizenship

Care recipient must be a Singapore Citizen or PR

Age/Condition

Care recipient must meet the following requirements

1. Above 65 years of age OR

2. Have a disability

a. As certified by a Singapore Registered Doctor OR

i. Doctor’s report/memo

ii. Functional Assessment Report

iii. IDAPE/Eldershield approval letter

b. Is currently receiving services from a voluntary welfare organization (VWO)

Training

Caregiver must have 100% attendance at an approved course under CTG

Please click here for more information on the scheme.

questionListItems.title: Where can I get the forms for the Caregivers Training Grant (CTG)?

answer.body: You can download the Caregivers Training Grant application form here.

questionListItems.title: Who can attend approved Caregivers Training Grant Courses?

answer.body: You or your helper (Migrant domestic worker) who takes care of your loved one can attend approved Caregivers Training Grant Courses. If both your helper and you attend courses together, the $200 Caregivers Training Grant annual subsidy would need to be shared between your helper and you.

questionListItems.title: What type of skills can my helper or I learn by attending approved Caregivers Training Grant Courses?

answer.body:
Your Migrant domestic helper or you would be able to learn skills such as day-to-day care techniques, clinical care and basic management of chronic conditions. You can also attend courses to learn how to care for yourself and manage your emotions when you look after your loved ones.

Please click here for more information on the Caregivers Training Grant (CTG) or approved courses from the Caregiver Training Courses e-calendar.

questionListItems.title: Is the Caregivers Training Grant $200 subsidy transferrable?

answer.body: The annual subsidy of $200 is not transferrable and must be used within the period of 1 April to 31 March the following year. Any amount not used will be forfeited. The annual subsidy of $200 must be utilised for courses attended.

The Seniors' Mobility and Enabling Fund (SMF) provides subsidies to seniors to age in place within the community for devices or home healthcare items (consumables).


Please click here for more information on the Seniors' Mobility and Enabling Fund (SMF).

questionListItems.title: Can I get device replacement under SMF?

answer.body:
Application for each device category is only once per lifetime. Repeat application for the same device category is not allowed.


Please click here for more information on the Seniors' Mobility and Enabling Fund (SMF).

questionListItems.title: What are the eligibility criteria for Seniors' Mobility and Enabling Fund (SMF) Assistive Devices subsidy?

answer.body:
Seniors applying for the Seniors' Mobility and Enabling Fund (SMF) Assistive Devices subsidy must meet the following conditions:

1. They must be a Singapore citizen aged 60 and older.

2. Their household monthly income per person is $2,000 and below, OR Annual Value (AV) of residence reflected on NRIC of $13,000 and below for households with no income.

3. They must not reside in a nursing home.

4. They must be assessed by a qualified assessor (such as a fully registered therapist, registered nurse, doctor and optometrist and certified audiologist) on the type of devices required.

5. This must be the first time they are making claims for the device category.


Please click here for more information on the Seniors' Mobility and Enabling Fund (SMF).

questionListItems.title: How do I apply for the Seniors’ Mobility and Enabling Fund (SMF) Assistive Devices subsidies?

answer.body:
Seniors currently undergoing therapy sessions with qualified therapist(s) in the restructured hospitals, community hospitals or other participating MOH-funded community-based care providers can approach their therapist to put up a SMF application for them. Otherwise, you may approach the Senior's doctor for a referral to a therapist s to seek help to put up the application for a suitable mobility device under SMF.


If the senior is not attending any therapy sessions and is not on any follow up at the restructured hospital, you may fill in the SMF application form and submit to us together with the following documents:


A copy of Senior's NRIC (Front and back)

Medical reports (if available)

Financial Assistance documents (if any)

All forms and supporting documents should be sent to AIC via mail:

Agency for Integrated Care

No. 7 Maxwell Road #04-01

Annex B MND Complex

Singapore 069111

OR email (scanned and attached in PDF or JPEG format) to: smf.community@aic.sg

Upon receipt of the documents, we will process the application.

If the senior has not been means-tested in the past two years or if there are changes to the address, household income per person or household members, please submit the Means Test Declaration Form with relevant supporting documents to the following address: 

Ministry of Health (MOH) Holdings

Harbourfront Centre Post Office,

P.O Box 074,

Singapore 910932


Please click here for more information on the Seniors' Mobility and Enabling Fund (SMF).

questionListItems.title: How do I know if I'm eligible for Seniors' Mobility and Enabling Fund (SMF) Home Healthcare Items (Consumables) subsidy?

answer.body:
Seniors applying for the Seniors' Mobility and Enabling Fund (SMF) Consumables subsidy must meet the following conditions:

1. They must be a Singapore citizen aged 60 and older.

2. Their household monthly income per person must be $2,000 and below. For household with no income, the Annual Value (AV) of residence on their NRIC must be $13,000 and below.

3. They must be receiving one of the following services: home nursing, home medical, home palliative services Singapore Programme for Integrated Care for the Elderly (SPICE), Integrated Home & Day Care (IHDC) packages.

4. They must undergo assessment to determine your needs and type of healthcare items required.

5. They must not be already receiving subsidies for the same items.


Please click here for more information on the Seniors' Mobility and Enabling Fund (SMF).

questionListItems.title: How to be eligible for Seniors' Mobility and Enabling Fund (SMF) Home Healthcare Items (Consumables) subsidy?

answer.body:
To apply for SMF Home Healthcare Item (Consumables) subsidies, please approach your respective home healthcare provider - Home Medical, Home Nursing and Singapore Programme for Integrated Care for the Elderly (SPICE) Centre to assist you in your application for SMF Consumables.


Please click here for more information on the Seniors' Mobility and Enabling Fund (SMF).

questionListItems.title: How can I apply for hearing aids under the Seniors' Mobility and Enabling Fund (SMF)?

answer.body:
SMF subsidy for hearing aids requires assessment by a qualified audiologist at the Ear, Nose & Throat (ENT) clinics at Restructured Hospitals and can only be applied through the Restructured Hospitals (RH). To obtain a subsidised referral to the RH, seniors may approach the polyclinics or a Community Health Assist Scheme (CHAS) participating clinic. When the senior visits the specialist, he/she will assess the need and suitability for a hearing aid. Thereafter, if the senior meets the criteria for a subsidised hearing aid under the SMF, the clinic will assist in putting up an application on the senior's behalf. Alternatively, seniors may approach the RHs directly at private rate for a private appointment.


Please click here for more information on the Seniors' Mobility and Enabling Fund (SMF).

questionListItems.title: What are the eligibility criteria for Seniors' Mobility and Enabling Fund (SMF) Motorised Devices subsidy

answer.body:
Seniors applying for the Seniors' Mobility and Enabling Fund (SMF) Assistive Devices subsidy must meet the following conditions:

1. They must be a Singapore citizen aged 60 and older.

2. Their household monthly income per person is $2,000 and below, OR Annual Value (AV) of residence reflected on NRIC of $13,000 and below for households with no income.

3. They must not reside in a nursing home.

4. They must be assessed by a qualified assessor (such as a fully registered therapist, registered nurse, doctor and optometrist and certified audiologist) on the type of devices required.

5. This must be the first time they are making claims for the device category.

6. Motorised devices - additional criteria

   a) They must not have a full time caregiver, or the caregiver is frail and not able to support the care needs

   b) They must not have the ability to use a manual wheelchair independently

   c) They must be mentally and physically able to safely use the motorised device


Please click here for more information on the Seniors' Mobility and Enabling Fund (SMF).

questionListItems.title: How do I apply for Seniors' Mobility and Enabling Fund (SMF) Motorised Wheelchair subsidies?

answer.body:
If your loved one is currently under the care of a public hospital, community hospital, day rehabilitation centre, or senior care centre 

You may approach the therapist or social worker to assist you in your application for SMF Motorised Devices.

If your loved one is currently NOT under the care of any public hospital or community hospital, day rehabilitation centre, or senior care centre

1. Download the following application form, or get a copy from any AIC Link 

- Terms and Conditions

- Motorised Devices Subsidy Application Form for Seniors’ Mobility and Enabling Fund (SMF)


2. Submit the following documents to apply for subsidy 

- Completed application form 

- Copy of Applicant's NRIC (front and back) 

- Copies of medical reports (e.g. Discharge summary, doctor’s memo describing applicant’s medical condition)

- Copies of financial assistance documents, if available (e.g. Public Assistance Card, Medifund, Medical Fee Exemption Card or MSF ComCare Short-to-Medium Term Assistance) 

3. Send the above documents to AIC at the following address 

Seniors' Mobility and Enabling Fund (SMF) 

No. 7 Maxwell Road #04-01 

MND Complex Annex B 

Singapore 069111 

Please click here for more information on the Seniors' Mobility and Enabling Fund (SMF).

questionListItems.title: I have already purchased a wheelchair, can I claim under the Seniors' Mobility and Enabling Fund (SMF) subsidies?

answer.body:
The Seniors' Mobility and Enabling Fund (SMF) is a co-payment scheme and applicant needs to top-up the balance and pay for the cost of maintenance. SMF does not provide retrospective disbursement for the mobility devices that you have already purchased


Please click here for more information on the Seniors' Mobility and Enabling Fund (SMF).
